channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trees over hanging., 7th August
item.description:
We live in a park home these trees are hanging about six feet away from our property and getting dangerous please can we have them trimmed back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 The Cloisters, Bishops Cleeve

item.title: Lloyds roundabout middle lane, 3rd August
item.description:
So there is a second job raised saying the highways/council can’t find it It’s been spray painted throughout the whole of July… so they have found it Indicating that highways/council have again failed their SLAS on this one (max of 21days to resolve once marked!!) It’s a repeat offender pothole and is located in the middle lane… more damage is caused coming from Elmbridge court towards Lloyds In 2018 this hole took out my tyre… it’s not that big yet but it might need a better patch job this year?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Barnett Way, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More rubbish flytipped, 2nd August

item.title: Parking, 30th July
item.description:
Our neighbour who lives at 1 Benhall Avenue parks up to 4 of his company vehicles (GMC Carpentry) outside his house and outside our house over night. He also buys and sells camper vans and large MPV's weekly and parks all of the vehicles outside his/our house as well. Some days it is quite literally a car park. At any one time there can be up to 8/9 vehicles of his parked outside his house and our house. The Benhall bus and large delivery vehicles struggles to get past as his large vans cover almost half the road and it's dangerous. He always parks two vehicles in between his house and Miserden Rd and if you are pulling out of Miserden Rd you can't see what's coming along Benhall Avenue - it's an accident waiting to happen as there are a lot of children on this road. Please can you do something about this. I've reported this before but nothing has changed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 24 Benhall Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terrible road surface - nothing being done, 30th July
item.description:
When are you going to fix this? drawing round the potholes with white paint is not fixing them!!!! there have been so many reports of this issue and you do nothing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley Lodge Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parked at pub sticking out into the road and causing an obstruction, 30th July
item.description:
The staff park their cars sticking out in the road and it causes a hazard, block the bus stop and obstructs traffic that has to go around them
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Kings Elm, Norton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sinkhole not repaired and warnings/barriers totally inadequate, 29th July
item.description:
This has been left like this for two weeks now. It is a busy A-Road in a built-up area and next to a busy supermaket entrance. There have been several near misses (horns blasting and at night this route is used by HGVs/Artics). The barriers are inadequate and falling down and there are no reflectors or flasing beacons to warn drivers at night. An accident is imminent if this is not addressed soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 163 Cirencester Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Branch comes into road and will hit double decker, 29th July
item.description:
Broken Branch comes into road and will hit double decker on entering Andoversford from the dual carriageway. Double Deck buses are to be used on this route from 29th August.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Puffers Cottage Gloucester Road, Andoversford
Report on FixMyStreet
